typeSystemDescription.name: hw1-lmahler-typesystem
typeSystemDescription.description:
This is the UIMA CAS Type System Descriptor for a sample information processing pipeline. The pipeline contains 5 stages:
1. Test Element Annotation: The system will read in the input file as a UIMA CAS and annotate the question and answer spans. Each answer annotation will also record whether or not the answer is correct. Input Types: N/a (text file as input) Output Types: Sentence, Question, Answer
2. Token Annotation: The system will annotate each token span in each question and answer (break on whitespace and punctuation). Input Types: Sentence Output Types: Token
3. NGram Annotation: The system will annotate 1-, 2- and 3-grams of consecutive tokens. Input Types: Token Output Types: NGram
4. Answer Scoring: The system will incorporate a component that will assign an answer score annotation to each answer. The answer score annotation will record the score assigned to the answer. Input Types: Question, Answer Output Types: AnswerScore
5. Evaluation: The system will sort the answers according to their scores, and calculate precision at N (where N is the total number of correct answers). Input Types: AnswerScore Output Types: N/a (text file or print results to screen)

typeDescription.name: qa.AbstractAnnotation
typeDescription.description:
The most abstract Annotation type in this namespace. All other Annotations inherit from AbstractAnnotation.

The source feature indicates the UIMA Analysis Engine (or other source) that generated this annotation.

The confidence feature indicates the confidence level of the Annotation. Although there is no upper or lower bound on this value, the confidence level is expected to fall within the range [0.0, 1.0].

featureDescription.name: source
featureDescription.description: the UIMA Analysis Engine (or other source) that generated this annotation.

featureDescription.name: confidence
featureDescription.description: the confidence level of the Annotation. Although there is no upper or lower bound on this value, the confidence level is expected to fall within the range [0.0, 1.0].

typeDescription.name: qa.AbstractSpanAnnotation
typeDescription.description:
An abstract Annotation type for annotations that cover text spans (as opposed to other media such as images or video).

Extends {@link AbstractAnnotation}. All other Annotations inherit from AbstractSpanAnnotation.

The begin feature indicates the position (offset from the beginning of the document) that indicates where the text span begins.

The end feature indicates the position (offset from the beginning of the document) that indicates where the text span ends.

featureDescription.name: begin
featureDescription.description: the offset (from the beginning of the document) that indicates where the text span begins.

featureDescription.name: end
featureDescription.description: the offset (from the beginning of the document) that indicates where the text span ends.

typeDescription.name: qa.Sentence
typeDescription.description: An Annotation type used to annotate label sentences.

typeDescription.name: qa.Token
typeDescription.description: An Annotation type used to annotate the tokens within a {@link Sentence}.

featureDescription.name: word
featureDescription.description: the raw text string annotated by the {@link Token}.

featureDescription.name: stem
featureDescription.description: the word stem of text string annotated by the {@link Token}. For example, if the raw text string (Token.word) were "living", the word stem (Token.stem) would be "liv".

featureDescription.name: pos
featureDescription.description: the Part of Speech of text string annotated by the {@link Token}. Ex: DT (determiner), NN (noun), etc.

featureDescription.name: orthographicShape
featureDescription.description:
the orthographic shape of text string annotated by the {@link Token}. For example, if the raw text string (Token.word) were "Living", the orthographic shape (Token.orthographicShape) would be "upperInitial". While orthographic shape types may be chosen by the user, here are type commonly used in other applications:

- upperInitial - initial letter is uppercase, rest are lowercase - allCaps - all uppercase letters - lowerCase - all lowercase letters - mixedCaps - any mixture of upper and lowercase letters not - included in the above categories

typeDescription.name: qa.Question
typeDescription.description: An Annotation type used to annotate {@link Sentence} types that are questions.

typeDescription.name: qa.Answer
typeDescription.description:
An Annotation type used to annotate an answer to a {@link Question}.

The isCorrect boolean feature indicates whether the Answer is correct (1) or incorrect (0).

featureDescription.name: isCorrect
featureDescription.description: boolean that indicates whether this Answer is the correct Answer to a Question.

typeDescription.name: qa.NGram
typeDescription.description: An Annotation type used to annotate n-grams (series of consecutive {@link Token} types). The elements feature stores an array of all {@link Token} elements covered by the text span.

featureDescription.name: elements
featureDescription.description: an array of all Tokens covered by the text span.

typeDescription.name: qa.AnswerScore
typeDescription.description:
An Annotation type used to annotate an {@link Answer} with its score (computed during the answer scoring phase).

The score feature stores the score associated with the answer (pointer to an {@link Answer}).

featureDescription.name: score
featureDescription.description: the score of the Answer, computed during the answer scoring phase.

featureDescription.name: answer
featureDescription.description: a pointer to the Answer associated with this AnswerScore.
